title: [BEAM-6574] Cherrypick #7697 to release-2.10.0, fixes website precommit
body:
This cherrypicks #7697 to the release branch, removing a 404 link. The failing website precommit obscures test signal on the release branch. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [INFRA-17335] Check more Python versions in inventory job
body:
Python `3.6, 3.7` are installed to all Jenkins nodes (see [INFRA-17335](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-17335)). title: Work around issue in dill for wordcount example save_main_session
body:
This change works around a bug in the dill library (https://github.com/uqfoundation/dill/issues/300), where classes fail to unpickle in the main session if its `super()` is referenced. This change modifies the wordcount example to not use such a reference. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6488] Portable Flink runner support for running cross-language
body:
Multi-language support in `DefaultJobBundleFactory`. Current status: - `DefaultJobBundleFactory` reuses a set of grpc servers if a new environment shares the same URN. - `DefaultJobBundleFactory` initializes a set of grpc servers as instance variables and creates `WrappedSdkHarnessClient` from them. Proposed changes: - Remove the usage of instance variables and refactor them to an immutable data structure `AutoValue_ServerInfo` to enable thread-safe initialization of `WrappedSdkHarnessClient`. - Allow multiple sets of grpc servers for each payload of the same URN so that we can use multiple docker images of different URL per language. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6554] Migrate from findbugs to spotbugs
body:
This migrate dependencies from findbugs to spotbugs, with some fixes. There appear to be issues introduced in spotbugs. - The change to suppression of a volatile warning was necessary even though it was already suppressed. Something about how spotbugs scopes the suppression made it not work for a nested lambda. - There is still a failure claiming that the `continuation` parameter to `SplittableProcessElementInvoker$Result` is marked nullable, which is not the case. I have not yet decompiled to debug. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6426] Fix regexp to enforce ban of non-vendored Guava
body:
By reusing the format property it was rewriting the regexp pattern so it did not find many cases. This is now fixed. The bad news is that Bigtable and Calcite are also leaking guava into Beam. I think it is really important to try to solve the Bigtable case. Hoping that the vendoring of Calcite solves the other one.
For Cassandra and Kinesis we are pretty much screwed but these are more specific.

R: @kennknowles @aromanenko-dev

title: [BEAM-6558] Add IWYU plugin, activate for Beam SQL, fix errors
body:
Beam SQL was successfully compiling and passing tests even though it had a totally straightforward compile-time dependency on commons-codec, which it did not declare. I had thought that Gradle made this issue a thing of the past, but it is not so. This adds the capability that we got from `mvn dependency:analyze` plugin. It found the known error and a couple other issues, which may or may not be spurious. This needs to be cherrypicked for 2.10.0 as Beam SQL was nonfunctional for 2.9.0. We can advise on a workaround to simply add the necessary dependency. We also need an end-to-end test that will ensure our shipped artifact works for users. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-4783] Fix issues created in #6181.
body:
Fix issues created in #6181 and incorrectly fixed in #6884 (although this PR increased readability greatly). Before any work on [BEAM-4783](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4783), GroupCombineFunctions would always use a `new HashPartitioner(rdd.rdd().sparkContext().defaultParallelism());`. The intent was to skip the creation of this `Partitioner` and call `groupByKey()` with no arguments **only** when the new bundleSize option was in use. #6181 actually did the opposite causing performance impacts, and because #6181 had terrible readability #6884 did not fix it correctly. I am also hopeful that this can be cherry picked into 2.10 if another RC is created to get the Spark Runner's performance back to the levels seen in 2.7. @iemejia @timrobertson100 ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-5658] Re-enable findbugs on Dataflow worker
body:
This fixes or suppresses all findbugs warnings on the Dataflow worker. These commits should not be squashed. In the event of a need for rollback it should be isolated as far as possible. There _are_ some actual functional changes, particularly where erroneous use of integer division is now double precision division. If they look like potential bugs, there is a Jira filed and linked in a comment. This does _not_ enable nonnull by default, so there are 100+ potential bugs lurking. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-5959] Add GCS KMS support
body:
GCS operations refactored to support objects with KMS keys. Beam will not set KMS keys on GCS objects. Users can utilize bucket default keys. Also adds --dataflowKmsKey, which is passed to DataflowRunner. Details: - GCS copy operation reimplemented as rewrite - allowing copies of objects using KMS keys (source or dest). - Rewrite also supports copying across regions and storage classes. https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/json_api/v1/objects/rewrite - Introduces --dataflowKmsKey flag, which should apply to Dataflow pipeline state. - If creating a new bucket for gcpTempLocation, sets the bucket default key to --dataflowKmsKey. - New integration tests: - GcsKmsKeyIT - pipeline with GCS sink using --dataflowKmsKey and gcpTempLocation. - GcsUtilIT - tests multi-part rewrite against prod GCS SImplified rewrite of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/7629 ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6527] Use Gradle to parallel Python tox tests
body:
This PR use Gradle to parallel Python 2 and 3 tox as well as integration tests (on DataflowRunner) in Python PreCommit by: - Group tests to Gradle tasks under multiple sub-projects: - beam-sdks-python:preCommitPy2 - beam-sdks-python-test-suites-tox-py3:preCommitPy3 - beam-sdks-python-test-suites-dataflow:preCommitIT - Build sdk artifact based on copy of sdk sources to avoid a concurrent issue in setuptools when using same `setup.py` (details: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/7793#issuecomment-462495172) - Start Cython tests after other tox tests since the side effects may affect the test behavior and result. Reduced ~30mins for the PreCommit build: - Before: 60mins: https://scans.gradle.com/s/irb2zhuymvnms - After: 31mins: https://scans.gradle.com/s/l7em7nt3nuxaq ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4008895/54300980-45737800-457b-11e9-9849-ac0e6a22355b.png) ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-4520] Warn when UnboundedSources are used without checkpointing
body:
This prints a warning when checkpointing is disabled and pipelines are run with the FlinkRunner which contain UnboundedSources. Most UnboundedSources rely on checkpoint acknowledgement, e.g. PubSubIO. title: [BEAM-6545] Remove useless allowance of null constructor in ByteArrayShufflePosition
body:
There is no reason to allow null here, except for coding laziness in the callers. I fixed the call sites and removed the pointless `@Nullable` annotations. I left a redundant null check in one of the methods just to avoid introducing a new NPE. There are many other methods in this class and its neighbors that accept null where they should not, and many incorrect annotations that findbugs seems to be missing. So I am worried that it would not find a null that was headed for `ByteArrayShufflePosition.of(null)`. That invocation makes no sense, but I would not assume it is impossible. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6540] Windmill quota piping
body:
Adds "dataflow_throttled_msecs" signal to windmill service worker. When a user reaches their quota limit on windmill service they receive a RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED RPC error which may cause a backlog to build up. To prevent autoscaling from scaling up workers in this scenario we count this throttled time against "dataflow_throttled_msecs" which is reported back to DFE by the worker. This CL does not include the work in the sizing policy to consume this signal. DataflowSystemMetrics: Adds "dataflow_throttled_msecs" as a StreamingSystemCounterName. While previous throttling has been on a per stage basis this is throttling is not specific to a stage. StreamingDataflowWorker: Adds windmillQuotaThrottling counter for "dataflow_throttled_msecs" and queries the client side windmillServer for the throttle time before reporting to DFE. GrpcWindmillServer: Keeps track of throttled time. Adds class ThrottleTimer to handle book keeping. Adds ThrottleTimer.start calls to streams when a RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED error is recieved. Adds ThrottleTimer.stop calls to streams when a successful response is recieved. GrpcWindmillServerTest: Adds testThrottleSignal. Moved to https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/7693 : Also adds the flag --EnableStreamingEngine in StreamingOptions and reports it to the backend in DataflowPipelineTranslator ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6510] Use TestFlinkRunner for Nexmark tests
body:
In streaming mode, the FlinkRunner does not shutdown after executing a pipeline because checkpointing does not work correctly otherwise. There was logic in the past that did an auto-shutdown in case checkpointing was disabled. The logic has been removed because it caused confusion for users. The `TestFlinkRunner` still has the auto-shutdown logic in place. title: [BEAM-6553] A Python SDK sink that supports File Loads into BQ
body:
This PR implements file loads into BQ from the Python SDK for Batch pipelines.

r: @chamikaramj 

### Open question
- Need to improve documentation significantly before merging.

### Features being implemented
- [x] Use of temporary tables for atomicity given a subset of load jobs failed
- [ ] Support for multiple destinations on streaming - **left for later PR.**
- [x] File Loads transform has not been wired up to `WriteToBigQuery`
- [ ] Support for time partitioning - **left for later PR.**
- [x] Support for multiple destinations
- [x] If a worker dies, and the same load job is triggered, it will fail because it willhave the same name as before.

### Test results
- [PreCommit without multiple destinations passing](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Portable_Python_Commit/1129/)
- [PreCommit with multiple destinations passing](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Python_Commit/3946/console)
- [PreCommit with BQFileLoads as main Batch transform](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Python_Commit/3973/), [ValidatesRunner tests](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Py_VR_Dataflow_PR/55/)
- [PreCommit with temporary tables created for multiple destination loads](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Python_Commit/3999/), [PostCommit tests](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Python_Verify_PR/329/)

title: [BEAM-5091] New wordcount integration test on DataflowRunner in Python 3
body:
This is an integration test that runs a simple version of wordcount pipeline and verifies output file content in Python 3. Due to BEAM-6158, the test disables `save_main_sessions` flag. Since it duplicates from the existing wordcout example's behavior, we don't need to run it in existing Python 2 suite. Create `Py3IT` tag for integration tests that's available in Python 3. Tests are done by running this test using DataflowRunner in Python 3.5. @tvalentyn @aaltay @RobbeSneyders ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-3667] Make embedded MongoDB instance per class and test code more robust
body:

title: [DO NOT MERGE] [BEAM-4775] Portable metrics over the job-server API
body:
## (Superseded by #7823) (also fixes [BEAM-4776](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4776) (Java) and [BEAM-4777](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4777) (Python) This currently sits on top of https://github.com/ajamato/beam/pull/1 (which adds a couple of tweaks to #7624) and #7656. [The last 11 commits](https://github.com/ryan-williams/beam/compare/job-metrics-base...ryan-williams:job-api-portable-metrics) (beginning with `add GetJobMetrics RPC, associated protos`) are hopefully well-differentiated, and represent the actual new functionality not covered by the PRs it's based on. With this merged: - python portable wordcount receives and prints metrics - (this requires #7656, which lets wordcount look for `attempted` metrics if there are no `committed` metrics) - portable VR Flink test cases covering "attempted metrics" can be enabled (see last commit) Submitting now to start CI-debugging, and also to seed some design discussions. title: [BEAM-6473] Materialize all inputs of transforms with side input collections
body:
In the Python ValidatesRunner test `test_flattened_side_input`, the PCollection `side` is materialized to be used as a side input of a transform. `side` is also used as input to a flatten operation together with the collection `side3`. However, `side3` is fused away and can't be reached for the flatten which is not fused due to `side` being materialized. The solution is to materialize all inputs to transforms which use side input collections as input. title: [BEAM-6513] Fix NPE in BeamEnumerableConverter
body:
`ConcurrentLinkedQueue` that is used in collector does not permit `null` as value. In fact, I find typical Java concurrent Queue/Array data structures do not permit `null` as value, including blocking queue/array. There are two ways to walk around it. One way is what is implemented in this PR. Another way is to use a normal LinkedList but does a synchronization in ParDo. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6381] Add additional debug output for metrics prober test failures
body:
This gives much better information about what was stale when the test fails. Now, it will output something like: ``` java.lang.AssertionError: Input data is stale! [id:1, dashboardId:5, dashboardUid:data-freshness, dashboardSlug:source-data-freshness, panelId:2, name:Source Data Freshness alert, state:ok, newStateDate:2019-01-20T22:45:02Z, evalDate:0001-01-01T00:00:00Z, evalData:[:], executionError:, url:/d/data-freshness/source-data-freshness] See: http://104.154.241.245/d/data-freshness. Expression: (alert.state != ok) ``` http://docs.grafana.org/http_api/alerting/ ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6154] Update google-apitools to 0.5.26 and fix gcsio in python 3
body:
google-apitools 0.5.26 contains a critical python 3 fix that help to unblock DataflowRunner in Python 3. The problem is described in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6154. This PR contains fix to the problem as well as upgrade google-apitools. **Note: this fix touches `base_image_requirements.txt` which is used to build Python sdk harness container image.** ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: Replace visteg plugin with gradle-task-tree to visualize task dependency tree
body:
Visualizing the Gradle task dependency tree is a useful tool for debugging build issues. We previously used the visteg plugin, although the project seems to be abandoned and not compatible with Gradle 5.0 This change switches over to using the gradle-task-tree plugin, which gives similar functionality (although only prints the tree to the commandline rather than a .dot file). Usage: ``` ./gradlew :myProject:myTask :myProject:taskTree ``` See: https://github.com/dorongold/gradle-task-tree ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.
